data.event: The county was formed in 1858 from land given by Madison, Estill, Owsley, Clay, Laurel, and Rockastle counties.

event.title: Presidential elections Jackson County has been strongly Republican for decades

data.event: Middle Schools: Jackson County Middle School (Grades 6 through 8) High Schools: Jackson County High School (Grades 9 through 12) Private Institutions: Annville Christian Academy (up to grade 8), Outreach Christian Academy (up to grade 12) In Presidential elections Jackson County has been strongly Republican for decades.
In 1940 Wendell Willkie received over 88% of the county's vote.

event.title: gave the Republican candidate the highest percentage in the 1928

data.event: The county gave the Republican candidate the highest percentage in the 1928, 1948, 1960, 1976, and 1988 Presidential elections.

event.title: every election of the last 53 years

data.event: Overall Republicans have won by solid margins in every election of the last 53 years.
